课程教师信息
王毅，男，中国科学院科技战略咨询研究院常务副院长、研究员，中国科学院大学可持续发展政策与管理系主任，中科院可持续发展战略研究组组长、首席科学家，中科院可持续发展研究中心副主任，中国科学院自然与社会交叉科学研究中心副主任，中科院国情研究中心兼职研究员；同时担任中国环境科学学会常务理事及多个学术机构的理事、委员，曾任国家中长期科技规划“生态建设、环境保护与循环经济”战略研究组成员、中国环境与发展国际合作委员会核心专家组成员、中国水土流失与生态安全综合科学考察专家组成员，并曾任世界银行、亚洲开发银行、全球环境基金、联合国开发计划署、联合国工业发展组织、欧盟驻华代表团、加拿大国际发展署、澳大利亚国际发展署、英国国际发展部、世界自然基金会、美国能源基金会、美国福特基金会等10多家国际组织和基金会的项目咨询顾问。目前主要从事可持续发展相关领域（包括资源、环境、流域管理、能源与气候变化等）的公共政策及发展战略研究。曾主持和参与过数十项国家自然科学基金、中科院重大项目及各部委委托的课题研究，参与过许多政府部门和有关机构的重大法律、规划、文件、政策建议的研究与起草工作，许多专题研究报告受到有关决策部门和社会各界的高度重视。共出版专著20多部（包括合著和编著）, 译著4部，发表学术论文百余篇，先后获部级科技进步一、二等奖，第四届中国青年科技奖。
陈劭锋，男，博士，中国科学院科技战略咨询研究院研究员，可持续发展战略研究所副所长，欧洲经济研究中心和柏林自由大学环境政策研究中心访问学者，联合国环境署专家，中国科学院可持续发展战略研究组核心成员，《中国可持续发展战略报告》技术报告首席科学家，《科技促进发展》杂志社副社长。长期从事可持续发展理论和可持续发展评估方向研究。先后主持和参与国家水污染治理重大专项、国家自然科学基金重点项目和面上项目、科技部科技攻关项目、中国科学院重点和重大项目等项目四十余项，合作出版和参与出版中英文著作20余部，在国内外刊物上公开发表论文80余篇，获得北京市科学技术二等奖一项（2004）、环境保护部中国环境宏观战略研究先进个人奖（2010）、中国第一届软科学研究奖提名奖（2011）。

现代化科学导论

课程编码：120100M02003H 英文名称：Introduction to Modernization Science 课时：36 学分：2.00 课程属性：一级学科普及课 主讲教师：何传启等

教学目的要求
《现代化科学导论》是一门新兴交叉科学，属于交叉科学的一个世界前沿。它从自然科学与社会科学相结合的角度，系统介绍世界现代化的主要理论和前沿过程，阐述国家发达的科学原理和基本方法，分析人类发展的世界前沿和发展趋势，解释我国现代化建设的基本国情和发展战略。为实现2035年基本实现现代化和2050年建成现代化国家，培养具有战略思维的复合型领军人才。
通过对本课程的学习，使学生能够从自然科学与社会科学的交叉角度，正确掌握现代化科学的基本原理和一般方法，建立现代化研究的全球视野和科学态度，了解世界现代化的主要理论和历史进程，掌握国家发达的原理和方法，理解人类发展的世界前沿和国际潮流，把握现代化建设和国家发达的政策分析方法，树立中国实现现代化和民族复兴的坚定信念。

预修课程
无

气候变化经济学研究前沿

课程编码：120400M03001H 英文名称：Frontiers of Climate Change Economics 课时：20 学分：1.00 课程属性：一级学科研讨课 主讲教师：吴静

教学目的要求
教学目的：了解气候变化的成因以及由此引起的气候、经济后果；掌握气候变化引起的社会经济损失的分析方法；掌握气候变化集成评估模型的建模原理、方法；了解应对气候变化的主要政策措施以及各措施可能产生的社会经济影响。为研究生参与气候变化政策模拟研究奠定基础。要求：掌握一定的经济学基础。

预修课程
无

教材

第四章 应对气候变化的经济学手段 4课时 吴静研究员主讲

第二节 碳税减排的经济影响模拟

公共管理学

课程编码：120400M01003H 英文名称：Public Administration 课时：54 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：叶中华

教学目的要求
一、教学目标：
公共管理学以政府和其他公共部门对公共事务的管理为核心，突破传统公共行政学的学科界线，把当代经济学、管理学、政策分析、政治学和社会学等学科的相关理论和方法融合到公共管理的研究之中，而形成的一门科际整合的应用性学科。
公共管理学是公共管理类一级学科研究生的专业核心课程，应作为其专业必修课，也可作为其它相应学科研究生的选修课。这门课程为本专业学生进一步学习和了解公共管理和政府治理提供了基本的知识框架和实际公共管理的背景知识。该课程鼓励学生运用所学的公共管理理论和方法，分析中国政府的实际公共管理和治理过程，做到学以致用。
公共管理学课程就是对公共管理的原则、理论、方法和实践的介绍和展开，其主要内容有公共管理的主体、职能、层级、公共部门的组织环境、政府绩效评估、人力资源管理、公共政策的制定、领导力、政府管理体制的改革以及公共管理发展的前景等。
本门课的教学目标在于，使研究生们能够掌握公共管理的基本概念、基本原理，了解公共管理的理论前沿和发展趋势。在教学过程中，还将引入一些经典案例进行深入探讨，使研究生们在实际情况中更好地理解和运用公共管理的相关理论，并在此基础上逐渐形成观察、思考、分析和解决有关理论和实践问题的能力。同时，希望能够为没有公共管理基础知识的研究生，在认识和理解政府管理及相关的社会现象方面，提供一个新的视角，一种新的思维方式。
二、教学方式
理论及知识点讲解——基本理论
案例研究——实践应用
课堂讨论——实现师生之间和同学之间的相互启发

预修课程
无

教材
1. 欧文?休斯《公共管理导论》，彭和平等译，中国人民大学出版社，2007年版
2. 陈振明主编 公共管理学 中国人民大学出版社2005年版。

主要内容
第一章：公共管理导论 公共管理 新公共管理 公共管理与时代的挑战
第二章：官僚制组织分析 西方官僚制组织 后官僚制 官僚制组织的未来发展
第三章：公共组织 公共组织环境
第四章：公共决策 公共决策理论 公共决策过程分析
第五章：公共财政 国家预算 税收制度 公共财政与宏观调控 公共产品供给与政府间财政关系
第六章：公务部门绩效测评和管理 绩效测评的类型、指标体系、方法和步骤 绩效管理的理念和实践
第七章：公共政策 公共政策 公共政策的合法化途径 公共政策的合理化
第八章：公共部门战略管理 公共部门战略管理的性质、过程 公共部门战略规划与战略管理
第九章：公共组织中的领导 领导与影响力系统 领导权力与领导效能 领导方式与领导效能
第十章：公务人力资源管理 人力资源管理的性质、功能与系统 人力资源管理者的角色与职能 现代公务人力资源管理发展的新趋势
第十一章：企业型政府与政府再造 企业型政府的实施策略 企业型政府与政府再造实践
第十二章：公共管理的新策略 公共服务的民营化 非营利组织与公共服务 公共部门的全面质量管理 公共管理的顾客导向
第十三章：公共管理中的责任与伦理 责任的行政控制机制 立法控制与责任 公共管理职业与职业伦理
第十四章：政府信息化与电子政务 政府信息化建设 电子政务与电子政府的产生和发展 政府信息化对管理模式的影响
第十五章：我国政府管理体制改革分析 政府管理改革的基本过程 政府再造的主要内容

参考文献
无

课程教师信息
叶中华，曾任中国科学院大学副校长，现任公共政策与管理学院公管系主任，教授，博士生导师，研究方向为政府管理与社会治理。近年来主持和参与主持了“高层次高素质公共管理人才培养研究”、等40多项科研课题，。在学术刊物上发表论文80余篇，专著6本。

公共伦理学

课程编码：120400M02003H 英文名称：Public Ethics 课时：36 学分：2.00 课程属性：一级学科普及课 主讲教师：刘红

教学目的要求
公共伦理学是研究公共管理活动中产生的伦理问题和道德现象的一门新型的应用伦理学学科。本课程是公共管理专业研究生的专业课和其他专业研究生的公共选修课，旨在培养学生从伦理学的视角思考和分析公共管理中的伦理问题的能力。通过讲授相关知识，使学生掌握公共伦理学的基本概念和相关理论；通过案例教学，使学生能够运用相关知识对当下公共管理中最为重要的现实问题进行分析，寻求解决方案；通过参与式讨论，使学生深刻理解公共管理的“伦理法典”，养成符合道德规范的行为。

预修课程
无

民法学

课程编码：030100M01001H 英文名称：Civil Law 课时：54 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：罗先觉

教学目的要求
教学目的：通过课堂授课和课堂研讨，讲授民法学的研究方法、基本原理和重要制度，着重讲解《民法典》的主要制度和创新，使学生掌握扎实的民法学研究方法和民法知识，具备开展民法学研究和解决实际民事法律问题的能力，为进一步学习民商法其他科目奠定扎实的理论基础。
要求：参加课堂学习和讨论，阅读《民法典》和指定书目，做读书报告。

预修课程
无

教材
王利明等：《民法学（第五版）》，法律出版社2017年版

科技法学

课程编码：030100M01004H 英文名称：Science and Technology Law 课时：54 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：段异兵等

教学目的要求
本课程通过讲授科学技术迅速发展而衍生的重要法律问题，增进学生对科技立法、科技政策、科研管理、科技工作者权益保护等科技相关事务的法律认识。按科技法的理论基础、调整科技活动内部关系、调整科技活动外部关系和科技法实务4个模块，探讨科技法的功能、特征、立法、适用、执行等问题，培养学生理解科技法律制度内在逻辑关系的认知能力，增强全球化、科技创新背景下完善中国特色科技法律制度的研究能力和职业技能。

预修课程
无

教材
1、参考教材：何悦. 科技法学教程. 法律出版社，2018；2、自行编写讲义：每讲提供阅读文献包，提前两周发给学生研读；课堂教学与讨论以此为范围。

第十二章 前沿科学和新兴技术的法律规制概述 段异兵主讲，3学时
第一节 前沿科学与新兴技术引发的复杂社会问题
第二节 新兴技术规制的全球协同机制
第三节 新兴技术规制的利益平衡原则
第四节 新兴技术规制的共同利益原则
第十三章 信息技术法律研究专题 段异兵主讲，3学时
第一节 网络犯罪行为的法律适用性问题
第二节 数据安全法与信息技术出口管制问题
第三节 共享经济的法律规制
第四节 人工智能体的损害赔偿
第十四章 生物技术法律研究专题 段异兵主讲，3学时
第一节 基因隐私权的民法保护
第二节 人体器官移植的立法问题
第三节 基因编辑技术的法律规制
第四节 新冠疫情及生物安全法相关的法律问题
第十五章 《科学技术普及法》相关问题探讨 唐素琴主讲，3学时
第一节 《科学技术普及法》的法律作用
第二节 我国科学技术普及的现状与主要规制问题
第三节 《科学技术普及法》的改进方向
第十六章 科技人员职务犯罪实务与案例分析 唐素琴主讲，3学时
第一节 科技人员职务犯罪的类型与罪名
第二节 科技人员贪污贿赂犯罪及案例分析
第三节 科技人员渎职罪及案例分析
第十七章 科技法学研究前沿研讨 段异兵主讲，3学时
第一节 文献讲读（指定中英文文献，学生提前研读，课堂报告并评议）
第二节 邀请知名科技法专家专题讲授和研究交流
第十八章 课程结课考试 段异兵、唐素琴，3学时

重点、难点：
教学重点包括：科技与法律的融合关系、科技法的法律地位及体系结构；科学共同体的运行规则与法律在科技领域适用的相容性；新兴技术发展的动态化与法律规制的滞后性；科技发展及全球科技治理规则；科学诚信治理的正当性和立法的必要性等。
教学难点包括：科技法的体系结构及与其他部门法的关系；促进科技发展的科技法治理体系；新兴技术发展的法律规制。

课程教师信息
段异兵，科技战略咨询研究院研究员，研究领域为技术政策与管理、新兴技术的法律规制研究。主持过科技部、国家自然科学基金委和中国科学院等部门多项研究项目，在前沿科学和新兴技术的政策与管理领域有20多年研究经历。中国科学学与科技政策研究会理事。担任本课程的首席教授。
唐素琴，中国科学院大学公管学院教授，研究领域为科技法、知识产权法。主持相关研究项目近20项。兼任中国科学技术法学会常务理事、中国知识产权法学研究会及中国知识产权研究会理事，国家知识产权局专家库专家，2017年获中国科技法学优秀人才奖。担任本课程的主讲教师。
段异兵和唐素琴两位老师组成的授课团队各有侧重，优势互补。在2015~2019年间已完成《科技法学》5年次教学工作，教学效果评估均为优秀。

课程教师信息
肖尤丹，中国科学院科技战略咨询研究院研究员，中国科学院大学公共政策与管理学院岗位教授。中南财经政法大学法学学士、法学硕士，中国人民大学法学博士，清华大学公共管理学院博士后。曾主持国家社科基金项目、国家自然科学基金项目、国家软科学研究计划项目等国家级课题二十余项，出版《开放式创新与知识产权制度研究》《历史视野中的著作权模式确立》《科研机构知识产权管理制度创新研究》《中国科技成果转化制度体系：法律、政策及其实践》《科技计划项目承担单位法人责任制研究》等5部专著，作为立法专家或咨询成员参与《促进科技成果转化法》《专利法》《科学技术进步法》《国防专利条例》等法律法规和《中国科学院章程》《中国科学院院士章程》《中国科学院研究所综合管理条例》等院重大规章制度修改工作。

课程编码：203300M01001H 英文名称：Hydrology, Freshwater Ecology and Biogeochemistry 课时：200 学分：8.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：宋献方等

教学目的要求
The objectives of the course are:
1. To learn how the hydrological cycle is working and of what components it consists, to learn physical hydrological equations and how measurements and sensors are relevant in modeling approaches used to estimate components in the hydrological cycle
2. To learn how freshwater systems function in respect to biological, physical and chemical aspects, to get insight in how microbial loops are part of freshwater systems, and to understand freshwater systems are affected by human impact and catchments
3. To learn how elements distribute between the different spheres, to get an overview of which biogeochemical processes govern distribution, transfers and transformations of the elements, to describe the interactions between the cycles of the different most important elements in different ecosystems, and to learn how human activities perturb the biogeochemical cycles at a global scale

预修课程
无

教材
1. George M. Hornberger, Patricia L. Wiberg , Jeffrey P. Raffensperger and Paolo D’Odorico (2014). Elements of Physical Hydrology, 2nd edition. John Hopkins University Press. ISBN-13: 978-1421413730 (the recommended text book)
Other useful books:
2. Elizabeth M. Shaw, Keith J. Beven, Nick A. Chappell, Rob Lamb (2011): Hydrology in Practice, Fourth Edition, Spon Press, Oxon, UK. This book is available for sale at the DTU bookshop.
3. W. Brutsaert (2005), Hydrology an Introduction, Cambridge University Press, Cambridge
4. Chow, V. T., et al. (1988), Applied Hydrology, McGraw-Hill, New York
5. Dingman, S. L. (2002), Physical Hydrology (2nd. Ed.), Prentice Hall, New Jersey
6. Fetter, C. W. (2001), Applied Hydrogeology, 4th ed., Prentice Hall, New Jersey
7. Margulis, S., 2014: Introduction to Hydrology, 414pp. (open-access multimedia electronic textbook); http://aqua.seas.ucla.edu/margulis_intro_to_hydro_textbook.html
8. Allan, J.D. 1995: Stream Ecology – Structure and function of running waters, Chapman and Hall, New York 1995.
9. Wetzel R. G. 2001: Limnology: Lake and River Ecosystems, 3rd Edition, Elsewier, Academic Press
10. Schlesinger, W.H; Bernhardt, E. (2013) Biogeochemistry. An analysis of global change. 3rd Ed. Acad. Press, 688 pages (selected chapters).

主要内容
The Hydrological module consists of lectures in combination with practical tutorials and assignments with real world hydrological problems. Notes, lecture slides and supporting material will be provided.
The Freshwater Ecology and the Biogeochemistry module consist of lectures in combination with colloquiums including student presentations and discussions and calculation exercises. Besides field sampling will be demonstrated and exercises will be performed to test the methodologies learned.

污染物与污染控制

课程编码：203300M01002H 英文名称：Pollutants and Pollution Control 课时：200 学分：8.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：崔岩山等

教学目的要求
Aim of the course is to introduce the fate and processes of the contaminants, the current status of the soil and water pollution and the techniques for the pollution control and water treatments.

预修课程
无

教材
Literature:
A. Pepper, I.L, Gerba, C.P., Brusseau, M.L. (2006) Environmental and pollution science. 2nd edition. Academic press, 532 pp.
B. Hansen, H.C.B. (2001) The filter function. Chapter 2 in Environmental Soil Chemistry, Matej Bel University, Slovakia, pp. 25-58.
C. Langmuir, D. (1997) Oxidation-reduction concepts. Chapter 11 in Aqueous Environmental Chemistry. Prentice Hall, New Jersey, pp. 403 – 430
D. Brezonik, P.L. and Arnold, W.A. (2011) Fundamentals of photochemistry and some applications in aquatic systems. Chapter 17 in Water Chemistry – an Introduction to the Chemistry of Natural and Engineered Aquatic Systems. Oxford Univer. Press. pp. 637 – 671.
E. Gillings, M.R. (2013) Evolutionary consequences of antibiotic use for the resistome, mobilome and microbial pangenome. Frontiers in Microbiology.
F. Pepper, I.L., Gerba, C.P., Gentry, T.J. (2014) Environmental microbiology. 3rd edition. Academic Press.
G: Min Qiao, Guang-Guo Ying, Andrew C. Singer, Yong-Guan Zhu (2018). Review of antibiotic resistance in China and its environment. Environment International 110: 160-172. doi: 10.1016/j.envint.2015.09.013. http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.envint.2017.10.016.

主要内容
Sub-module 1 – Pollutants – fate and processes
Contents
The sub-module include the following topics:
? Pollutants and their retention in soil: Pollutant properties, soil and water characteristics, sorbent characteristics and sorption reactions, redox transformations, soil solution composition, metal speciation, hydrolysis and photodegradation, degradation kinetics
? Simple methods for equilibrium computation and QSAR estimations
? Environmental microbiology including microbial ecology, metal transformations and effects, degradation pathways and kinetics, antibiotic resistance
Teaching and Learning Methods
The teaching comprise sessions of combined lectures and theoretical exercises involving discussions, calculations and small computer-exercises.

Sub-module 2 - Pollution control and water treatment
Contents and Perspective
Page 4/7
This sub-module will provide the students with
? Understanding of processes of importance for the transformation and removal of selected pollutants from wastewater and contaminated surface water;
? Training in the use of process modelling in activated sludge systems;
? Tools to prepare conceptual designs of treatment systems capable of achieving specific treatment goals.
Teaching and Learning Methods
Lectures, process modelling exercises, preparation using reading material, student assignments done using peer-coaching groups; oral presentation (in group)

Sub-module 3 - Soil and groundwater pollution
Content and Perspective
? Sources to soil and groundwater pollution
? Transport, mixing, attenuation and degradation of pollutants in soil and groundwater
? Diffuse source (arsenic, pesticides) contamination in aquifers
? Soil and groundwater chemistry of heavy metals, creosote compounds, petroleum hydrocarbons related to contaminated sites
? In situ and ex-situ technologies for remediation of polluted soil and groundwater
Teaching and Learning Methods
Lectures, theoretical and practical exercises, hands-on tutorials on groundwater transport codes, article reading and group presentations.

参考文献
Sub-module 1. Pollutants – fate and processes
A. Pepper, I.L, Gerba, C.P., Brusseau, M.L. (2006) Environmental and pollution science. 2nd edition. Academic press. 120 p

神经生物学

课程编码：203100M01001H 英文名称：Basic Neuroscience 课时：120 学分：6.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：孙坚原等

教学目的要求
Provide knowledge about general physiology (in relation to the central and peripheral nervous system), neuroanatomy, neurophysiology, neurotransmission, movement and sensation, complex brain functions, neuropharmacology, neuroimaging (mostly related to radioligand techniques) and neural blood flow into a neuroscience platform, which can be the foundation for other advanced master courses in neuroscience and neuroimaging.

预修课程
无

教材
Most of the course content is based on “Neuroscience” by Purves. However, in some of the topics a list of proposed reading is supplied (see Moodle). It is predominantly based on review articles in journals where downloading from PubMed most often is possible. Please note that some of the listed articles are additional reading for those with special interest.
General covering multiple subjects
Purves D et al (eds). Neuroscience. Sunderland: Sinauer Association. 1-759.
Principles of Human Physiology (5th edition) by Cindy Stanfield, Pearson Education Inc.
The relevant chapters are listed for each lecture. Where applicable a list of pages in the chapter that are exempt will be supplied by the lecturer (this content will not be examined)
Aspects of Brain Imaging
Zaidi H, Shidahara M. Neuroreceptor imaging (Chapter 11). In Choi I-Y, Gruetter R, eds. Neural metabolism in vivo. (Series: Lajtha A, ed. Advance in Neurobiology). Heidelberg: Springer. 2012; 4:305-29
Barrett JE, Coyle JT, Williams M. Translational Neuroscience: Applications in Psychiatry, Neurology, and Neurodevelopmental Disorders. Cambridge 2012.

主要内容
The course introduces the students to key concepts in neuroscience and neuroimaging starting by describing the physiological function of, and interactions between, the different organ systems within animals. Emphasis will be placed on the general mechanisms of physiological functions, where the course will take a comparative approach to highlight the basic principles of functions that are shared amongst all living animals. There will also be an emphasis on regulation of physiological functions and hierarchies of physiological regulation will be discussed. The course is also an introduction to the molecular and cellular components of the central nervous system (CNS), their development and organization. The course will provide an elementary overview of the structure and function of nervous system, with special emphasis on functional systems responsible for sensorymotor, autonomous, and cognitive function and their importance for major brain diseases within the fields of neurology, neurosurgery and psychiatry. Furthermore, an introduction to the different signaling pathways, electrical and receptor-neurotransmitter mediated signaling between neurons and other cells in the CNS will be given. The fundamental principles of diagnostics and treatment of major brain diseases will be discussed including knowledge about the dysfunction of the different signaling systems. Based on this knowledge, the molecular neurobiological aspects underlying different brain imaging methods will de discussed. Specifically, the basis for our understanding of the biology linked to the use of PET radio ligands, of MRS, of optical imaging, of two-photon imaging, and of hyperpolarized MR-substances. The course also describes molecular aspects of the coupling between function, flow, and metabolism. Finally, higher brain functions will be discussed.

参考文献
Neuroscience (6th edition) by Dale Purves et al, Sinauer Associates. Inc
Principles of Human Physiology (5th edition) by Cindy Stanfield, Pearson Education Inc.
Articles and slides from lectures

研究方法

课程编码：203600M01003H 英文名称：Research Methods 课时：60 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：-

教学目的要求
The aim of module 3 is to give students a fundamental knowledge, understanding, and skills in scientific paradigms and methodologies (quantitative and qualitative) and their application (selection and use) when investigating scientific and practical problems.
Following the successful completion of the module the students will be able to:
1. Define and compare alternative scientific paradigms and designs
2. Define and discuss strengths and weaknesses of alternative methods for data collection and analysis.
3. Apply scientific methods in exercises and projects
4. Define and compare alternative scientific paradigms and designs
5. Define and discuss strengths and weaknesses of alternative methods for data collection and analysis.
6. Apply scientific methods in exercises and projects

预修课程
无

教材
?Eriksson and Kovalainen (2011) Research Philosophy in Qualitative Methods in Business Research, SAGE Publications
?Su (2018) Positivist Qualitative Methods in Cassell, Cinliffe, and Grandy, The SAGE Handbook of Qualitative Business and Management Research Methods, SAGE Publications
?Rynes, S., & Gephart Jr, R. P. (2004). Qualitative research and the Academy of Management Journal. Academy of Management Journal, 47(4), 454-462.

主要内容
The course serves as an opportunity for the students to hone their skills in quantitative and qualitative research methods and methodological considerations in relation to conducting academic research and writing academic projects. The course connects with the meta-theoretical context for discussing and developing academic research. The central argument is that justifications of inferences and warranted assertions depend on the interconnections between research questions, theory, research design and analysis and that the coherence of these interconnections – philosophically and methodologically – are crucial in order to design and conduct research projects that create valid and reliable knowledge. In particular, the importance of the practical skills involved in carrying out research will be emphasized throughout.

The course will provide students with insights in the following main areas:
1. How to plan and carry out survey studies, interviews and ethnographic fieldwork
2. How to develop pertinent research questions which take into account theory, philosophy of science, and methodological considerations
3. How to select the most appropriate research design and match research questions with theory, philosophy of science, data collection methods and modes of analysis
4. The methodological considerations involved in case studies and comparative research

The course will focus on research design, methodology, qualitative research and quantitative research methods. The course comprises four sections. The first section consists of lectures on core issues in methodology, including the interconnections between research questions, research design, use of theory in design, analysis and inference, and ways of doing inference and warranted assertions. The three following sections concern three different core methods in social science and business studies: ethnographic methods, interview methods and survey methods. Each section will include lectures, group work, and practical exercises. The students will, in their project groups, carry out a mini project within each of the three method sections, drawing on the research question(s) and object of research set out for their First Semester Project. Within each of the three method sections, the students will, individually, write a short essay reporting on the mini project drawing on the relevant literature and lectures.

参考文献
?Piekkari and Welch (2018), The Case Study in Management Research: Beyond the Positivist Legacy of Eisenhardt and Yin
?Eriksson and Kovalainen (2018), Case Study Research in Qualitative Methods and Business Research

课程编码：203700M01002H 英文名称：Comparing Societies and Economic Systems 课时：60 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：-

教学目的要求
This course aims at providing a broad overview of the most important features of the two societal systems primarily addressed in the PMSD programme, the Chinese and the European systems (as well as variations within Europe). The course will serve as a broad introduction to the general themes and framework of the programme. This will include introductions to key theories and concepts of state, power, socioeconomic systems, citizenship and governance. The course will also introduce and illustrate how to conduct comparative inquiries in the social sciences. Finally, the course will start up the work on the semester project that will be continued in the third course of this semester on Research Methods.

预修课程
无

教材
The course uses contemporary research literature from political science, sociology and political economy to equip students with knowledge about different ways of understanding state/society relations in comparative perspective. All material for this course will be available online on Moodle. All students participating in this course are required to attend the class regularly, read the required texts assigned for each session and participate actively in discussions.

主要内容
CONTENT
This course aims to provide a broad overview of the most important features of the two societal systems primarily addressed in the programme, the Chinese and the European system (as well as variations within Europe). The course will serve as a broad introduction to the general themes and framework of the programme. This will include introductions to key theories and concepts of state, power, socioeconomic systems, citizenship and governance. The course will also discuss and illustrate how to conduct comparative inquiries in the social sciences.
The course combines lectures with student discussions and presentations. Active student participation in terms of preparing for classes and involvement in discussions with the faculty and fellow students is expected.
The course will start up the work on the First Semester Project. The aim of the project is that students acquire insights and skills in social scientific research questions and research practice related to the field of public management and social development. The students must combine social scientific methods and theoretical concepts to analyse a specific issue in public policy, government-business relations or social development which they choose in dialogue with the project supervisors.
The theme for the First Semester Project is comparative policy analysis related to the issues discussed in the course. The project must apply methodological approaches from the course Research Methods. The project must have a comparative component, for example cross-nationally or between organisations/companies, regions and the like.

课程编码：203700M01001H 英文名称：Research Methods 课时：60 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：-

教学目的要求
Aim
The aim of the course is to provide students with the skills required for designing and planning a research study, conducting different types of qualitative and quantitative research and analyzing qualitative and quantitative data. The focus will be on understanding the necessary steps involved in doing research, in particular: data collection, data analysis, drawing inferences and reporting results. The goal is to enable students to integrate theoretical reflections and practical experiences in carrying out small-scale empirical research. Specifically, the students will work with and develop practical skills in survey research, qualitative interviews and ethnographic fieldwork.
Learning objectives
Following the successful completion of the course, the students will be able to:
? Pose meaningful research questions and choose appropriate research designs
? Define and discuss strengths and weaknesses of alternative research designs
? Collect and analyze quantitative and qualitative empirical data and be able to select the right methods and apply them appropriately to answer research questions
? Draw inferences and make warranted assertions based on empirical analysis
? Apply survey, interview, and fieldwork methodology in exercises and projects

预修课程
无

教材
Literature
The basic content of the course is covered in the main textbook:
? Bryman, A. (2016) Social Research Methods. Oxford University Press.
For the second part of the course on quantitative methods, the following text book will be used:
? Imai, K. (2017) Quantitative Social Science: An Introduction. Princeton University Press
For the third part of the course on quantitative methods, the following book will be used:
? Scott, J. (2017) Social Network Analysis. 4th Edition, Sage Publications Ltd.

主要内容
The course serves as an opportunity for the students to hone their skills in quantitative and qualitative research methods and methodological considerations in relation to conducting academic research and writing academic projects. The course connects with the meta-theoretical context for discussing and developing academic research. The central argument is that justifications of inferences and warranted assertions depend on the interconnections between research questions, theory, research design and analysis and that the coherence of these interconnections – philosophically and methodologically – are crucial in order to design and conduct research projects that create valid and reliable knowledge. In particular, the importance of the practical skills involved in carrying out research will be emphasized throughout.
The course will provide students with insights in the following main areas:
1. How to plan and carry out survey studies, interviews and ethnographic fieldwork
2. How to develop pertinent research questions which take into account theory, philosophy of science, and methodological considerations
3. How to select the most appropriate research design and match research questions with theory, philosophy of science, data collection methods and modes of analysis
4. The methodological considerations involved in case studies and comparative research

参考文献
Mandatory:
Fuller, Steve. Kuhn vs. Popper: The struggle for the soul of science. Columbia University Press, 2004. (pages 1-17, recommend read through page 33)
Crotty, Michael. The foundations of social research: Meaning and perspective in the research process. Sage, 1998 Textbook: Bryman (2012): chapters 1 and 2
Optional:
(highly recommended) Winch, Peter. The idea of a social science: And its relation to philosophy. Routledge, 2002., Chapter 1 (pages 1-24)
Silverman, David (1993) ‘Theory and Method in Qualitative Research’ and ‘The Logic of Qualitative Method’, in: Silverman, David (ed.) Interpreting Qualitative Data: Methods for Analyzing Talk, Text and Interaction, London: SAGE: 1-29.

课程编码：203500M01001H 英文名称：Transport Processes 课时：80 学分：4.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：-

教学目的要求
To introduce the participants to the modeling and numerical description of flow, heat and mass transport based on the fundamental equations of change.

A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
1. Describe the molecular processes behind viscosity, thermal conduction and diffusion
2. Obtain analytical solutions for flow problems with simple boundary and initial data
3. Formulate and analyze models for combined flow and heat transport
4. Formulate and analyze models for combined flow and diffusion
5. Formulate and analyze models for combined flow and chemical reaction
6. Do order of magnitude estimates for key quantities such as fluxes, reaction rates and equilibration times
7. Use CFD for the simulation of flow with combined heat and mass transport (COMSOL)
8. Evaluate the accuracy of approximations obtained by Computational Fluid Dynamics
9. Formulate models for transport with a small or large parameter (boundary layers)

预修课程
无

教材
R. B. Bird, W. E. Stewart, E. N. Lightfoot: “Transport Phenomena”, Wiley, latest English language edition. Notes, problems, CFD exercises and projects uploaded on CampusNet.

主要内容
Mechanisms for the transport of momentum (flow), energy and mass in chemical and biological systems. Introduction to computational fluid dynamics (CFD) as basis for analysis and simulation of transport processes. Applications in the design of equipment and analytical instrumentation in the chemical, biotechnological and pharmaceutical industry.

参考文献
R. B. Bird, W. E. Stewart, E. N. Lightfoot: “Transport Phenomena”, Wiley, latest English language edition. Notes, problems, CFD exercises and projects uploaded on CampusNet.

教学目的要求
At the end of the course, the students should be able to:

? calculate mass balances for fermentations including gas-liquid mass transfer.
? calculate carbon and degree of reduction balances for fermentation processes.
? evaluate the feasibility of fermentation processes in an industrial context.
? analyse the consistency of experimental data using simple models.
? describe different types of growth kinetic models.
? calculate the heat of production of fermentation processes.

无

Role of fermentation in industrial manufacture of chemicals. Stoichiometry of cellular reactions, degree of reduction balances, yield coefficients and black box models. Scale-up and design of fermentation processes. Process evaluation project.

课程编码：203500M01003H 英文名称：Industrial Reaction Engineering 课时：60 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：-

教学目的要求
To provide the students with a fundamental and practically applicable understanding of industrial important types of reactions and reactors that can be used in chemical and biochemical production processes and in pollution control.

预修课程
无

教材
Course notes, three home exercises, three course assignments.

主要内容
A major part of chemical reactions in production processes and in gas cleaning processes takes place in multi-phase reactors, e.g. Production of pharmaceuticals, calcination of lime in the production of calcium hydroxide, production of cement, combustion of solid and liquid fuels in the production of power and heat, catalytic and non-catalytic cleaning of flue gas and catalytic production of important products in different reactors including two or more phases. The examples are homogeneous or heterogeneous catalyzed, gassolid, gas-liquid, liquid-solid and gas-liquid-solid reactions that take place in a number of different reactor types (batch fixed bed, moving bed, spray absorbers, packed towers, membrane reactors, fluidized bed reactors, entrained flow reactors etc.). The theory covering the different types of reactions and a number of the reactors is expounded together with examples. During the semester the students cooperate in teams solving practical oriented reactor design problems.

参考文献
Course notes, three home exercises, three course assignments.

教学目的要求
To provide the students with basic knowledge about the biorefinery concept and integrated processes that convert biomass into multiple products of bioenergy, biomaterials and biochemicals.

A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
1. Describe the physical and chemical structures of biomass and their potential use for production of bioenergy, biomaterials and biochemicals
2. Identify and describe biomass resources (forest, agricultural, municipal and marine biomass), their occurrence and application in a biorefinery concept
3. Identify and describe biomass constituents (starch, cellulose, hemicellulose, lignin, pectin, protein, lipids)
4. Outline the principles of a biorefinery including chemical, biological and thermo-chemical conversion methods
5. Outline and compare various methods of biomass processing for production of bioenergy products, biomaterials, chemicals and building blocks for chemical synthesis
6. Design a theoretical and creative biorefinery based on scientific references

预修课程
无

教材
The study material will be based on a compendium and international journal articles that will be uploaded on campusnet

主要内容
The course will give a broad perspective over the biorefinery concept by introducing the key integrated processes, such as biomass production, pretreatment, and chemical-, biological- and thermo-chemical- conversion. The lectures will focus on bioresources and single processing steps and will include industrial and scientific examples. In the case study the students will combine multiple processing steps into a novel biorefinery concept. There will be emphasis on sustainable systems throughout the course.

教学目的要求
The general purpose of the course is to qualify the student (1) to analyse an organisation from a strategic, tactical and operational perspective: (2) to define the strategy and the business model of a company; and (3) to understand how engineers contribute to the competitive advantage of a company.

A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
1. Identify and summarize key theories and models from the curriculum
2. Explain and describe business models, organizational design and management activities in a specific case
3. Apply theories and models from curriculum in a solution proposal for a specific problem and explain the relevance of the chosen theories and models
4. Analyze a specific case from a strategic, tactical and operational perspective
5. Formulate a synthesis including managerial, organizational and business perspectives in relation to a specific problem
6. Select organizational interventions and management activities from curriculum to support the implementation of a strategy in a company and make an argumentation for your selection
7. Outline the assumptions and preconditions of a specific problem and give an account of the consequences on the possible solution if these assumptions and preconditions are changed

课程编码：203400M01002H 英文名称：Analytical Biochemistry and Sample Preparation for Omics 课时：80 学分：4.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：娄晓敏等

教学目的要求
An Omics investigation is inevitably preceded by sample enrichment and purification based on the biochemical and/or physico-chemical properties of the group of molecules to be analysed. This purification is crucial, because an Omics experiment should only assay a defined group of molecules (e.g. DNA but not RNA); from a technical point it is important that samples do not contain impurities that can spoil instrumentation. Quite different purification concepts are required, because the groups of molecules subjected to an Omics study are highly diverse.This course will give theoretical and experimental insight into various enrichment and separation techniques employed in Omics studies, and outline the requirements for sample purification prior to the actual Omics analysis

预修课程
无

教材
Articles, reviews and handbooks which will be placed on Moddle during the semester.

主要内容
The theory behind methods used for separation and purification of RNA, DNA, proteins, peptides and metabolites will be covered, including methods based on affinity, hydrofobicity, polarity, charge and size:
1. Extraction and purification of proteins, RNA, DNA and metabolites from biological samples.
2. Chromatographic techniques
3. Electrophoretic techniques
4. Selective purification/enrichment for post-translational modifications
5. Labelling and quatitation in Proteomics
6. Sample preparation and data analysis in metabolomics
7. Sample preparation for lipidomics
8. Sample preparation for Genomics/Transcriptomics
9. Digestion of biomolecules
10. Interfacing chromatography with mass spectrometry

Practical laboratory work will include:
1. Reverse phase liquid chromatography
2. Gas chromatography
3. Lipid purification
4. Protein purification
5. Two-dimensional electrophoresis
6. MALDI peptide mass finger printing and MALDI MS/MS for identification; data analysis
7. Sample preparation for transcriptomics
8. Sample preparation for Genomics

参考文献
Articles, reviews and handbooks which will be placed on Moddle during the semester.

课程编码：203400M01005H 英文名称：Personalized Track 课时：80 学分：4.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：-

教学目的要求
At the end of the course, the student is expected to be able to:
? critically evaluate scientific results in the original research literature.
? present scientific results in an oral seminar given in English.
? discuss strengths and limitations of modern techniques in Omics.
? identify scientific problems connected to Omics-approaches and reflect on application of the
different available techniques to solve relevant biological questions.
? identify the “method of choice” for analysis of a given biological sample.
? select the "method of choice" for answering a specific biological question.
? demonstrate skills in general experimental design, planning of experiments, interpretation of
experimental data and note keeping in execution of experiments.
? independently take responsibility for his/her own professional development and specialisation,
including application for financial research support.
? disseminate research based knowledge and discuss professional and scientific problems with both
peers and non-experts.
? write a scientific paper presenting the results from the Thesis. This paper should ideally be submitted
to a peer-reviewed scientific journal.

预修课程
无

教材
Selected scientific review and research papers delivered to the students via Moodle prior to the lectures.

主要内容
The main objective of this part of the Omics programme is to provide the individual student with the basic
knowledge required to select a theme for the master’s thesis, and more over provide a contact that can serve
as a "help-desk" throughout the whole study, although with main emphasis on the final master's thesis. Thus,
this course will be the glue of the entire study programme.
The objective is to introduce a range of applications of Omics and presentation of various relevant areas of
research, which will help the student in selecting his/her personal “biological” question that will follow the
student through the study programme and form the basis for the master’s thesis. Skills acquired in the
courses focused on technical, analytical, biological and bioinformatics as well as “entrepreneurship” will be
applied to the personal “biological” question selected.
Moreover, the student will learn about project management, scientific writing and oral presentation of a
scientific topic to peers and to non-experts. Standards in publication ethics and scientific conduct will be
discussed. Scientific standards that are expected by peer-reviewed journals will be presented.

参考文献
Selected scientific review and research papers delivered to the students via Moodle prior to the lectures.

英文名称: Rethinking Classical and Modern Theory and Methodology: theorizing and method sensitivity in Social Science
详细内容:
反思古典与现代理论与方法论：社会科学中的理论与方法敏感性

课程编码：203600D01002H 英文名称：Rethinking Classical and Modern Theory and Methodology: theorizing and method sensitivity in Social Science 课时：34 学分：2.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：-

教学目的要求
This PhD course aims at providing the PhD students with appropriate skills, knowledge, and capacity to choose and develop the best possible theoretical and methodological framework for their projects. Furthermore, the course will teach the students how to theorize. Very few students know tthe art of theorizing. The course will stress the importance of the classical tradition within social science theory and methods but the project is to rethink and modernize the classical legacy in order to conceptualize problems and challenges in the 21st century. We need a new mode of theorizing combined with more coherent methodologies. Finally, the course will present some fairly new middle-range theories, and some methods. Throughout the whole course the PhD-students will work on their projects in relation to the theories and methods discussed in class.

预修课程
无

教材
Readings marked with * must be read *Abbott, A. 2016. Processual Sociology. University of Chicago Press. L. Althusser/E. Balibar. 1970 .Reading Capital. Verso Arrighi, G. 2004. The Long Twentieth Century. Verso. Bourdieu, P. 1977. Outline of a Theory of Practice. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press. *Bourdieu, Pierre. 1992. The Logic of Practice. Polity. Pierre Bourdieu Lo?c J. D. Wacquant. 1992. An Invitation to Reflexive Sociology. Polity Cassirer, E. 1953 Substance and Function, New York: Dover. Coleman, J. 1992. The Foundation of Social Theory. Harvard University Press. Dewey, J. and Bentley, A. F. 1949 Knowing and the Known, Boston: Beacon Press.*Durkheim, E. 1992. The Division of Labour. D. Easley & J. Kleinberg. 2010. Networks, Crowds, and Markets. *Elias, N. 1974 ‘Towards a Theory of Communities’ in Colin Bell and Howard Newby (eds.), The Sociology of Community. A Selection of Readings, London: Frank Cass & Co. *Elias, N. 1978 What is sociology? New York: Columbia University Press. Elias, N. 1987a Involvement and Detachment, Oxford: Blackwell. Elias, N. 1987b ‘The Retreat of Sociologists into the Present’, Theory, Culture & Society 4(2-3): 223-248. Elias, N. 2000 The Civilization Process. Oxford: Blackwell.Elias, N. 2001 The Society of Individuals. London: Continuum. *Emirbayer, M. 1997 ‘Manifesto for a Relational Sociology’, The American Journal of Sociology 103 (2):281-317. R. Hanneman & M. Riddle Introduction to Social Networks Methods (2005) Hall, P. & Soskice, D. 2001. Varieties of Capitalism.(introduction) Jessop, B. 1990. State Theory: Putting States in Their Place. Cambridge: Polity Press. Marx, K. & Engels, F. 1848. The Communist Manifesto. Penguin. *Marx, K. 1852. The Eighteenth Brumaire of Louis Bonaparte. In K. Marx, Early Writings. London: Penguin. *Marx, K. 1865. Capital (vol. 1). Penguin Miliband, R. 1969. The State in the Capitalist Society. *Polany, K. 1944. The Great Transformation.*Schumpeter, J. 1942. Capitalism, Socialism, and Democracy. Scott, John P. (2000). Social Network Analysis: A Handbook (2nd edition). Thousand Oaks, CA: Sage Publications. *Richard Swedberg. 2016. Before theory comes theorizing or how to make social science more interesting (plus response to commentators), The British Journal of Sociology 2016 Volume 67 Issue 1, pp. 5–22, 57–70. Richard Swedberg. 2015. The Art of Social Theory. Cornell University Press. Richard Swedberg. 2014. Theorizing in Social Science: The Context of Discovery. *Richard Swedberg. 2011. Theorizing in Sociology and Social Science: Turning to the Context of Discovery. Theory and Society, 41(2012):1–40. Richard Swedberg. 2010. Thinking and Sociology. Journal of Classical Sociology 11,1:1–19. Wallerstein, I. 1974. The Modern World-System I. New York: Academic Press, Inc. *Weber, M. 1968. Economy and Society. University of California Press.

主要内容
The course is structured around five issues:

- What is theory, what is theorizing and how do we increase the ability to theorizing?

- We read and discuss some classical texts within organization studies, public administration, comparative political economy, and innovation studies – how is theorizing understood here?

- We discuss problems and challenges when we want to do comparative studies
(unit of analysis, comparing what?, diachronic comparison, synchronic comparison)

- We read and discuss two types of more recent theory development: 1) substantialist theories (institutional theory and rational choice) 2) relational theory (Bourdieu, Elias, Abbott). How do they theorize? What is theory? Are they all empirical sensitive?

- We are introduced to social network analysis. We discuss problems and prospects of this method.

Teaching style
The teaching style of the course is a mixture of lectures and student presentations. A large part of the course consists of dialogues in which students are expected to be active.

Learning objectives
The course will introduce a number of different perspectives on the art of theorizing.

By confronting different (classical and modern) theories students will achieve knowledge and experience which will help them in their future academic careers in terms of theorizing and developing more coherent theoretical frameworks.

Following from this the students will learn that any theoretical framework facilitates and constrains the character of methods. They will learn when a theory is empirical sensitive and how theory and method is tied together.

The students will learn about the ’new paradigm’ – relational social theory and methodological relationalism.

Moreover, the students will become familiar with social network analysis.

Level
PhD

ECTS
5

Language
English

参考文献

课程编码：0710I0D01003H 英文名称：The Frontier of Genomics and Precision Medicine 课时：60 学分：4.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：孙英丽等

教学目的要求
Epigenetics and chromatin structures, DNA replication and DNA damage, and response and repair of DNA damage in chromatin environment. The first section provides an introduction to the concept of “epigenetics” and the structures of chromatins. It covers chromatin remodeling and the modifications of DNA and histones, and their roles in chromatin structure maintenance and chromatin based signal transduction. For the second part, by studying of this section, student should know the principles of DNA replication and cellular checkpoint, understand how cells sense and repair damaged DNA. The third provides current understanding of how chromatin modifications or higher structures contribute to DNA damage response (DDR) in chromatin context, and in this section we will also discuss how DDR defects will contribute to cancer development.

预修课程
Molecular biology, Statistics, Computer programming

教材
无

主要内容
Contemporary life sciences and medicine are moving towards the era of large data as represented by high-throughput sequencing. How to model, analyze and interpret genomic data will determine whether we can quickly and accurately discover new biological phenomena and rules, and provide accurate medical care for patients. This course will introduce common data types in genomics, such as DNA-seq, RNA-seq, and statistical analysis and graphing methods commonly used in data analysis, including exploratory data analysis, linear regression, data dimension reduction and clustering. The course will discuss genomics literature and data, and use the R language programming environment for data analysis and graphing exercises.

参考文献
1.《An Introduction to Statistical Learning with Applications in R》
Gareth James, Daniela Witten, Trevor Hastie and Robert Tibshirani, Springer
Free PDF version: http://www-bcf.usc.edu/~gareth/ISL/
NOTE: This book is only suggestive, not imperative.
2. 《Epigenetics》, Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory Press; 2 edition S by C. David Allis, Marie-Laure Caparros, Thomas Jenuwein , Danny Reinberg.
3. 《The Biology of Cancer》, Second Edition，Robert A. Weinberg，Garland Science

教学目的要求
The goal of this course is to introduce postgraduate students to the field of animal developmental biology, and to help them understand how the choice of model organisms matters for their research.

预修课程
无

教材
无

主要内容
Topics related to growth, differentiation, morphogenesis and organogenesis in different model animals would be covered. Using genetic and molecular biological techniques, developmental biologists have moved beyond animal developmental anatomy and now study the causal mechanisms of development using a number of invertebrate and vertebrate model organisms. Thus, animal developmental Biology has a rich and fascinating history as people, events, and disciplines coalesced to form the field. It continues as one of the most rapidly expanding areas of biological research.

课程编码：0706I0D01002H 英文名称：Overview of Climate Change Sciences 课时：60 学分：4.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：康世昌等

教学目的要求
Climate Change Science 2018 fall semester is designed as an introductory course in the climate system change and related Issues for graduate students majored in Earth Sciences. The class will give students an overview of climate system and its changes and impacts, mitigation and adaptation of climate changes as well as some updated developments in selected fields. As a course for graduate students a mini-seminar series are incorporated into the course to provide examples of research conducted in selected fields. This course covers the components of the climate system including atmosphere, cryosphere, hydrosphere, biosphere, anthroposphere, and their changes as well as mechanisms, forcing, attribution and predictions of the changes, multisphere interactions in Earth surface. Impacts, mitigation and adaptation of climate changes and regional and global sustainable development are also introduced. The course is structured as a series of lectures and mini-seminars in which individual research cases are discussed with faculty tutors.

教学目的要求
This course is challenging for many students because of the highly quantitative nature of the field of remote sensing. In order to assist all students in the course, I have identified several keys to success in this course:
1. Attend all lectures which are critical components of this class. Attending lecture will make the difference of an entire grade.
2. Read the assigned text chapters/sections before coming to class.
3. During lectures, focus on listening to the material being presented and synthesizing this information by taking notes that summarized the key points.

预修课程
无

教材
无

主要内容
Participation in lectures, discussions, and other activities is an essential part of the instructional process. Students are expected to attend class regularly. Those who are compelled to miss class should inform the instructor of the reasons for absences. Unexcused late assignments will have at a minimum 5 points deducted. To avoid this penalty you must contact the instructor prior to the due date. Students will freely form a group (including maximum 3 members in each group) and each group is expected to give a group presentation on the topical area of Assignment-2 in front of the class. The presentation will be followed by discussion during which other students are expected to ask questions and engage. The group presentations will be limited to 10 minutes and Q&A will be limited to 5 minutes (depend on the number of students). Students will be graded both as presenters and participation in discussion.

教学目的要求
This course includes three sections: inorganic semiconductor nanostructures, organics functional nanostructure and characterization of nanomaterials. The first section provides atoms-to-device introduction to the latest semiconductor quantum heterostructures. It covers nanostructures growth, their electronic, optical, and transport properties, their role in exploring new physical phenomena, and their utilization in devices. For the second part, by studying of this section, student should know the history and principles of organic electronics, understand how to use various strategies to produce organic functional nanomaterials, get the ideas how to construct organic electronic and optoelectronic devices, including filed effect transistors, light emitting diodes, and photovoltaics. The third provides Electron microscopic characterization of nanomaterials, Spectroscopic characterization of nanomaterials and some latest applications of nanomaterials.

Solid state physics, semiconductor physics, general chemistry，physical chemistry

课程编码：0817I0D01004H 英文名称：Multiphase Reactor Theory and Analysis 课时：51 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：刘晓星等

教学目的要求
Reactors involving multiphase flow (gas-liquid, gas-solid, liquid-solid, gas-liquid-solid ) are commonly encountered in a variety of chemical engineering processes. For the proper design, operation and optimization of chemical reactors handling multiphase flows, it is critical to get a basic understanding of the hydrodynamic, mass- and thermal transfer, and reaction characteristics of multi-phase systems. This course will be started with basic knowledge of chemical reaction theory, followed by a general introduction of the characterization and classifications of multi-phase flow phenomena. The heaviest parts of this course will be contributed to the introduction of the hydrodynamic, mixing and heat transfer phenomena occurred in the gas-solid fluidized bed reactors, the related measurement techniques and instrumentation, and typical applications of fluidized bed reactors. Technologies of numerical modelling of multiphase reactors will also be addressed and discussed.

预修课程
Be familiar with the basic knowledge of multi-phase (gas, liquid, solid) system and transport phenomena.

无

主要内容

2 Rate laws

4 Distribution of residence time

7 particle characterization and fluid (particle)-particle interaction
8 Dense Fluidization 1
9 Dense fluidization 2
10 CFB & Design Criteria
11 Mass and heat transfer
12 Application of Fluidization Bed Reactors
13 Numerical simulations of multiphase reactors 1;
14 Numerical simulations of multiphase reactors 2;

课程编码：0703I0M01001H 英文名称：Organometallic Chemistry 课时：50 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：孙文华

教学目的要求
Chemistry is the center of sciences, and organometallic chemistry is the useful tool for chemists to understand how organic molecules or groups interact with compounds of the inorganic elements. On the base of Organometallic Chemistry, the industries of chemical, petrochemical, pharmacy and organic materials have been continuously developing. A catalyst increases the rate of a reaction without being consumed and without changing the thermodynamics of the reaction, providing bases for modern chemical industries. With regard to Periodic Table of Elements, main group elements consisting of the s and p blocks and the transition elements of the d and f blocks would be discussed, respectively. Those organometallic compounds have been useful building blocks for nanoparticles and assembling materials. Importantly, organometallic compounds have been stoichiometric reagents and (pre)catalysts in tremendously industrial processes. Therefore organometallic chemistry and catalysis are the Capital Stone for scientists in chemistry, material science and industry.

General chemistry

教学目的要求
The goal of the course is to provide the students with knowledge and hands-on experience in developing data mining algorithms and applications. Firstly, the course will introduce the motivation of data mining techniques. Then, present the principles and major classic algorithms in data mining. Next, the course will introduce some successful applications to the students. Finally, advanced topics and the most recent techniques will be introduced as well.

预修课程
data structure, computer algorithms, programming, database

教材
Data Mining, Concepts and Techniques. Jiawei Han and Micheline Kamber, Morgan Kaufmann, 2006.

主要内容
Section 1: Introduction
Motivation, major issues, major applications, characteristics
Section 2: Data warehouse
Model, architecture, operations
Section 3: Data pre-processing
Data cleaning, data transformation, data reduction
Section4: Association rules
Apriori, FP-Growth, Partition, DIC, DHP, multi-level association rules, quantitative association rules, major applications
Section 5: Classification
Decision tree, Bayesian Classifier, Classification by backpropagation, KNN classifier, statistical prediction models, major applications
Section 6: Clustering
Partitioning methods, hierarchical methods, density-based methods, grid-based methods, major applications
Section 7. Sequence mining
GSP, SPADE
Section 8: Applications
Credit scoring, oil exploration, customer relationship management, cosmological simulation
Section 9:Big data mining
Big data, big data characteristics, big data mining techniques including high performance mining, Web mining, stream mining, graph mining, text mining, cloud mining, etc.
Section 10: Project Discussion & Demo
Students and the instructor discuss the course projects in class, and students present their work and make demonstrations.

参考文献
To be announced in class

课程教师信息
Ying Liu received her B.S. degree from Peking University, China, in 1999, the M.S. degree and the Ph.D. degree from Northwestern University, Evanston, IL, USA, in computer engineering in 2001 and 2005, respectively. She is professor in School of Computer Science and Technology, University of Chinese Academy of Sciences. She also holds an adjunct appointment with the Key Lab of Big Data Mining and Knowledge Management of Chinese Academy of Sciences. She is the recipient of NVidia Global Professor Partnership in 2009. She is selected to be a CUDA Teaching Center by NVidia in 2012 and Research Center as well. Her research interests include high-performance computing, data mining, and big data. She has already published 80 papers in peer-reviewed journals and preceedings of international conferences. She has been the PI for more than 20 research projects, including NSFC projects, enterprise sponsored projects, etc.

课程编码：0704I0D01001H 英文名称：Fundamentals of Modern Astronomy 课时：50 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：苟利军等

教学目的要求
By the conclusion of this course, students should be able to:
?Explain the scientific process and how scientific theories are developed and tested.
?Recall basic physical concepts such as gravitational and conservation laws, and how light and matter interact.
?Describe the general characteristics of the universe.
?Apply scientific thinking to the natural world to understand, e.g. what powers the sun, why galaxies differ, and how the universe began.
?Formulate a scientific hypothesis, identify a testable prediction, verify by carrying out an experiment, and assess the results.

预修课程
无

教材
无

主要内容
This course is designed primarily for the non-astronomy student who wishes to explore in depth a single topic in astronomy without becoming involved in detailed mathematical developments. In the process, we will see how scientific ideas develop and how scientists think about or approach problems.

This course is an introduction to our modern view of the universe, its contents, and how they got to be the way they are. Among the topics we will discuss are galaxies, quasars, stars, and black holes as well as the modern cosmology. For each of these objects, we will talk about what they are, how they are observed, how they form, and how they fit into the overall scheme of things in the universe. Due to the constraints of time, there are a number of topics, which we will not be able to discuss in detail. These omissions are made not because the subjects are of no interest to astronomers, but rather because we will not have time to discuss all of the interesting and important topics in astronomy.

参考文献
The Essential Cosmic Perspective, 7 th(or 6 th) Edition by Bennett, Donahue, Schneider, & Voit; Pearson Press.

课程编码：0703I0D01001H 英文名称：Organometallic Chemistry and Catalysis 课时：50 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：孙文华

教学目的要求
Chemistry is the center of sciences, and organometallic chemistry is the useful tool for chemists to understand how organic molecules or groups interact with compounds of the inorganic elements. On the base of Organometallic Chemistry, the industries of chemical, petrochemical, pharmacy and organic materials have been continuously developing. A catalyst increases the rate of a reaction without being consumed and without changing the thermodynamics of the reaction, providing bases for modern chemical industries. With regard to Periodic Table of Elements, main group elements consisting of the s and p blocks and the transition elements of the d and f blocks would be discussed, respectively. Those organometallic compounds have been useful building blocks for nanoparticles and assembling materials. Importantly, organometallic compounds have been stoichiometric reagents and (pre)catalysts in tremendously industrial processes. Therefore organometallic chemistry and catalysis are the Capital Stone for scientists in chemistry, material science and industry.

General chemistry

课程编码：0710I0D01002H 英文名称：Plant Molecular Biology and Genomics 课时：60 学分：4.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：景海春等

教学目的要求
This course invites lab bench-based researchers from Institute of Botany, Chinese Academy of Sciences, to share their cutting-edge knowledge of Plant Molecular Biology and Genomics. The course will explain the concept of the gene, genome and epigenome, and theories and experimental tools/platforms to explore their variations, functions, interactions and regulatory networks in the context of plant speciation and evolution, growth and development as well as adaptation to the environments. Emphasis will also be given to how to translate know-hows gained from the basic science into plant breeding. The course puts more weight into how to rationalize, design and execute scientific researches, rather than to spoon feed the attendees with jargons to memorize. We encourage actively answer-seeking rather than rote learning, do require the attendees to have ideally at least college-level education in Plant Biology and relevant fields.

无

课程编码：0710I0D01004H 英文名称：Fundamental Immunology 课时：52 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：方敏等

教学目的要求
Fundamental Immunology is designed as a comprehensive course of immunology for research postgraduates in biology field. The class will give students a general view of immunology and some detailed development in certain selected area of immunology. As a course for postgraduates research case studies are incorporated into the course to provide examples for researches carried out in respective fields. This course covers the components of the immune system, Innate immunity, the cell biology of antigen processing and presentation, antibody and B cells, T cell response, the molecular structure and assembly of MHC molecules, and the pathogenesis of immunologically mediated diseases and immune system as defense system against infectious disease and tumor, and immunology as tool for general biology including antibody technology and flow cytometry. The course is structured as a series of lectures and mini-seminars in which individual research cases are discussed with faculty tutors.

预修课程
Immunology, Cell Biology, Microbiology，Virology

教材
无

主要内容
Section 1: Introduction of Immunology and Innate Immunity
1. Introduction of Immunology;
2. Cells and Tissues of the Immune Systems;
3. The development stages of Immunology
4. Features of Innate Immune Recognition;
5. Components of the Innate Immune System;
6. NK cells: General properties of NK cells; NK cell development and differentiation; NK cells in anti-viral immunity; Memory NK cells
Section 2: Adaptive Immunity
1. Humoral Immunity: Immunoglobulins: Structure and Function; Antigen-antibody interactions and Monoclonal Antibody; B lymphocytes evelopment and Biology; B lymphocytes Signaling Mechanisms and Activation.
2. Cellular Immunity: T cell Antigen Receptors; T lymphocyte Signaling Mechanisms and Activation; Development of T cells; Peripheral T lymphocyte responses and Function.
3. Antigen Presentation: MHC Structure, Function, and Genetics; Cell Biology of Antigen Processing and Presentation.
Section 3: Immune Systems and Diseases
1. Immunity to infectious Agents: The Immune Responses to Parasites and bacteria; Immunity to Viruses; Vaccines; Research case study.
2. Immunologic Tolerance and Autoimmunity: B lymphocyte tolerance, and tolerance induced by foreign protein antigens; T lymphocyte tolerance; Mechanisms of autoimmunity; Advances in immunologic tolerance and autoimmunity.
3. Immunity to Tumors: Overview and tumor antigens; Immune responses to tumors and evasion of immune responses by tumors; Immunotherapy for tumors and the role of innate and adaptive immunity in promoting tumor growth; Advances in immunity to tumors

参考文献
Cellular and Molecular Immunology, 8th Edition, Edited by Abul K .Abbas, Andrew H. Lichtman, and Shiv Pillai
Fundamental Immunology, 7th Edition, Edited by Paul, William E.
Principles of Virology, 3rd Edition, Edited by S.J. Flint, L.W. Enquist, V.R. Racaniello, A.M. Skala

教学目的要求
This course is designed as an introduction course of plant physiology and developmental biology for graduate students. In this course, we will discuss plant physiology and developmental events during plant life and the underlying mechanisms controlling such plant developmental processes and responses to environmental stimuli. Emphasis will be given on the molecular genetic basis of the developmental events. The entire life span will be examined, from gametocyte development to embryogenesis and post-embryonic development, such as root, leaf, flower and fruit development. Hormones and signal transduction will also be discussed.

Environmental and Natural Resource Economics course is designed for research postgraduates in Environmental Sciences field. The class will give students a general view of environmental and natural resource economics and some detailed development in certain selected areas. As a course for research students, a mini-seminar series are incorporated into the course to provide examples for researches carried out in respective fields. 教学目的要求
This course will introduce the field of geodynamics, the study of dynamical processes of the solid Earth. As such, it is rooted in fundamental physics and highly interdisciplinary. Mathematics is the central tool used to apply physical theories and create predictive models of the Earth. Geodynamics provides the quantitative foundation for the theory of Plate Tectonics, the basic organizing paradigm for our understanding of the solid Earth.

预修课程
Calculus, general physics

教材
无

主要内容
Section 1: Plate tectonics （8 hours)
Section 2: Stress and strain in solids (4 hours)
Section 3: Elasticity and flexure (4 hours)
Section 4: Heat transfer (8 hours)
Section 5: Gravity (4 hours)
Section 6: Fluid mechanics (8 hours)
Section 7: Rock rheology (4 hours)
Section 8: Faulting (4 hours)
Section 9: Flows in porous media (4 hours)

课程编码：070400M01002H 英文名称：Radiative Processes in Astrophysics 课时：60 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：刘碧芳

教学目的要求
本课程是为天文学科天体物理专业研究生开设的专业基础课，也可供相关物理专业研究 生和天文工作者选修。该课程是联系基础物理和天文学的桥梁，是天体物理研究者的基本 工具之一。要求学生熟悉电动力学、电磁理论，对量子力学和狭义相对论理论有初步的了 解和简单运用。课程将系统讲述天体物理中辐射过程的基本概念和原理，包括经典辐射理 论和(半)量子辐射理论，以及辐射转移，基础性与系统性兼备。课堂讲授着重物理分析， 有必需的理论推导，强调理论在各类天体中的应用，适当联系当前天体物理研究中的一些 前沿问题。课程还包含较多的、理论联系实际的课后练习，以及综合运用辐射机制和辐射 转移的小课题，学生必须有一定的课后练习时间。通过本课程的学习，要求学生掌握天体 物理中辐射的基本过程、相应物理、以及应用技能，帮助学生较快进入天体物理研究课题。

预修课程
电动力学，相对论，量子力学，热力学与统计物理

教材
主教材: Radiative Processes in Astrophysics (George B. Rybicki & Alan P. Lightman) 辅助教材: 1)教师课件; 2)天体物理中的辐射机制 (尤峻汉著，科学出版社)

主要内容
总体计划:每周一讲，每讲 3 学时，共计 20 讲，第 20 次课考试(+答疑)，力争课程与秋 季学期同步。
第一讲:引言
? 交待课程的整体安排、教学计划和考核方式、必备教材及参考书目 ? 辐射在天体物理研究中的意义与重要性
? 天体物理中辐射的基本概念 (主教材第一章 1-3 节)
第二讲:主教材第一章:辐射及辐射转移的基本知识(4-6 节) ? 辐射转移
? 热辐射、普朗克函数、黑体辐射;相关的温度定义
? 爱因斯坦系数及其相互关系;吸收、发射系数与爱因斯坦系数 第三讲:主教材第一章:辐射及辐射转移的基本知识(7-8 节)+应用
? 散射;随机游动
? 吸收和散射共存条件下的辐射转移方程及特定条件下的解
? 辐射耗散:罗斯兰近似;爱丁顿近似;双流近似
? 本章基本内容在天体物理中的应用(选自教材Problems+文献资料)
第四讲:主教材第二章:辐射场基本理论 ? 麦克斯韦场方程
? 平面电磁波

参考文献
此教学大纲结合国外研究生课程和国内研究生教育的要求而制订，包含的教学内容主 要来源于哈佛大学研究生教材“Radiative Processes in Astrophysics”(主教材)和尤峻 汉著《天体物理中的辐射机制》(辅助教材)，教学内容还包含了 Gabriele Ghisellini 所 著 “Radiative Processes in High Energy Astrophysics”中的部分内容。 此外，在制定此 大纲过程中，还参阅了加州大学伯克利分校、芝加哥大学、德克萨斯大学奥斯汀分校 等学校研究生同名课程的教学内容。大纲中未列出的作业部分也选自主教材及上述各 校的课后作业内容(Problem Sets)。

高等天文学

课程编码：070400M01003H 英文名称：Advanced Astronomy 课时：60 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：刘继峰

教学目的要求
本课程介绍现代天文学中不同层次的天体的观测特征以及与之相连的天体物理概念，以课堂讲授为主，辅之以少量课后作业和课程论文。在覆盖各种天体的观测的同时，强调对天文现象的物理解释和对宇宙的理解角度，并着力培养独立调研及科学合作的能力。本课程为天文学各专业研究生的学科基础课，也可作为空间科学等相关专业研究生的选修课。

预修课程
先修课程：高等数学、英语、天文学导论、电动力学、量子力学、热力学与统计物理

教材
《今日天文》等

主要内容
1． 引言：天文学的发展历程和全景图（作业）
a) 古老的天文学（1学时）
b) 望远镜的演变（1学时）
c) 多层次的宇宙（1学时）
2． 太阳系行星系统所告诉我们的
a) 太阳系中的各种天体（1学时）
b) 太阳系是如何形成的（1学时）
c) 行星是如何形成的（1学时）
3． 类地行星和如何制造可居住的世界（作业）
a) 行星地球和她的月亮（1学时）
b) 地球的左邻右舍（1学时）
c) 作为生命摇篮的地球（1学时）
4． 类木行星和千奇百怪的小伙伴们
a) 多姿多彩的类木行星（1学时）
b) 类木行星的卫星们（1学时）
c) 千奇百怪的小伙伴们（1学时）
5． 太阳系外行星系统的搜寻和发现（作业）
a) 被恒星隐藏起来的行星们（1学时）
b) 寻找系外行星的各种方法（2学时）
6． 作为恒星的太阳和她亿万个朋友
a) 稳定恒久的能源提供者（1学时）
b) 恒星的分类方法（1学时）
c) 恒星的赫罗图（1学时）
7． 建造和校准恒星结构的模型（作业）
a) 如何决定恒星的结构（1学时）
b) 从结构模型到观测证实（1学时）
c) 恒星的脉动和周光关系（1学时）
8． 恒星是怎样炼成的
a) 星际间的气体和尘埃（1学时）
b) 从分子云到恒星（1学时）
c) 恒星形成的展示场（1学时）
9． 恒星们或漫长或短暂的生命
a) 恒星在主序上的演化（1学时）
b) 恒星晚期的加速演化（1学时）
c) 恒星演化的观测证实（1学时）
10． 恒星的墓碑：白矮星、中子星和黑洞（作业）
a) 超新星如何爆发和显现（1学时）
b) 简并压支撑的白矮星和中子星（1学时）
c) 黑洞—神秘的时空漩涡（1学时）
11． 无处不在的星际介质所蕴含的的丰富信息
a) 我们是如何逐步认识星际介质的（1学时）
b) 探测不同形态的星际介质（1学时）
c) 星际介质如何维持平衡（1学时）
12． 银河系，我们的家园 （作业）
a) 银河系结构是如何被逐步认识的（1学时）
b) 银河系的旋臂和晕（1学时）
c) 银心的超大质量黑洞（1学时）
13． 星系动物园：从星系到星系团
a) 星系分类的哈勃音叉（1学时）
b) 从星系到星系团（1学时）
c) 捕获看不见的暗物质（1学时）
14． 活动星系核与类星体
a) 活动星系核的观测与分类（1学时）
b) 解释所有现象的统一模型（1学时）
c) 星系中心的超大质量黑洞（1学时）
15． 宇宙的产生和演化 （作业）
a) 量天尺和宇宙膨胀的观测（1学时）
b) 大爆炸宇宙学的观测证实（1学时）
c) 宇宙结构形成和加速膨胀（1学时）
16． 2010白皮书之外：天文学的将来
a) 已有和研制中的天文观测设备（1学时）
b) 三十年后的天文学在做什么（1学时）
c) 我国的天文观测设备（1学时）
17． 开卷考试（2小时）

An Introduction to Modern Astrophysics, by Carroll & Ostlie
The Essential Cosmic Perspective, by Bennett, Donahue & Schneider

课程教师信息
刘继峰，汉族，中共党员，研究员，博士生导师。中国科学院国家天文台银河系三维结构研究团组首席科学家，中国科学院大学天文与空间科学学院副院长。个人主页：http://www.bao.ac.cn/gkjj/zb/xrld/201812/t20181226_5221147.html

天文学史

课程编码：070400MGX001H 英文名称：History of Astronomy 课时：40 学分：1.00 课程属性：公共选修课 主讲教师：黎耕

教学目的要求
天文学史是一门通识性课程，立足于为各个基础的研究生普及基本的天文学及天文学史常识，加深对天文学，乃至近代科学思想的认识与看法，更好地掌握和反思天文学的研究方法，从而提高学生的天文素养与综合素质，建立正确的历史观。通过学习本课程，要求学生了解天文学的起源和发展历史，尤其是近代天文学革命以及天体物理学的重大进展，掌握天文观测技术和分析手段对科学发展的影响，领会人类探索和认识宇宙在广度和深度上取得的历史性进步，把握天文学与物理学以及光学、电子技术等相关科学技术的密切联系，同时了解太阳系、恒星、星系、宇宙等结构体系的形成及其研究进展，加深对天文学的基本概念和思想的理解，认识天文学的本质、发展规律，及其在整个科学进步和人类文明发展史中的重要意义和作用，从而激发学生进一步学习天文学知识和从事天文观测的兴趣和热情。
建议天文学及相关专业学生选修，并欢迎各个专业学生选修。

预修课程
无

教材
1. 钮卫星：《天文学史：一部人类认识宇宙和自身的历史》，上海交通大学出版社，2011年。
2. 宣焕灿：《天文学史》，高等教育出版社，1992年。

主要内容
霍金说：“我们不过是一颗不起眼的渺小行星上的一群高级灵长类动物。但是我们却能理解宇宙，这足以让我们与其他物种截然不同。”天文学史不仅是一门传授科学知识的课程，更是一门启发科学思想与反思科学方法的课程。它将引导你踏入了解宇宙的大门，一起分享托勒密、哥白尼、开普勒、伽利略、牛顿、拉普拉斯、沙普利、爱因斯坦、爱丁顿、贝尔、哈勃、霍金等人的科学成就与人生悲喜，了解东西方天文学坎坷的发展历程，望远镜发明后的黄金时期，以及人类背负梦想飞向太空的激动时刻。
本课程分为古代天文和近代以来的天文学两大部分组成。古代天文学突出早期天文学成就以及天文学起源等问题，按照国别与时间顺序来讲授。近代以来的天文学突出天体物理学、天体力学与天体测量学的发展历程，按照学科分支与时间顺序来讲授，
第1讲 绪论：百分之五的宇宙（3学时）

课程教师信息
黎耕，国家天文台副研究员，中国科学院自然科学史研究所博士，中国科学院-德国马普学会伙伴小组成员。主要研究方向为中国古代天文学，目前在进行陶寺古观象台及考古天文学研究等项目的研究。热衷科普事业，曾参与中国科技馆新馆、山西科技馆新馆、榆林科技馆等设计工作

课程名称: 射电望远镜设计与实现
英文名称: Technology and Design of Radio Telescope
详细内容:
射电望远镜设计与实现

课程编码：070400M02003H 英文名称：Technology and Design of Radio Telescope 课时：48 学分：2.00 课程属性：一级学科普及课 主讲教师：李建斌等

教学目的要求
通过本课程的学习，建立射电望远镜各组成部分的基本概念，为学生将来使用望远镜培养基础，了解射电望远镜使用到的各种技术。初步掌握望远镜的关键指标，为以后使用和建设射电望远镜打下基础；养成对射电望远镜各种技术的兴趣和工程基础。

预修课程
《大学物理》、《电磁场》、《信号与系统》。

星系天文学

课程编码：070401M04002H 英文名称：Galactic Astronomy 课时：60 学分：3.00 课程属性：专业核心课 主讲教师：马骏

教学目的要求
本课程为天文学科各专业硕士、博士研究生的学科基础课，也可作为物理及其他有关专业研究生的选修课。星系作为恒星和星际物质诞生和演化的场所，以及构成宇宙的基本单元，在现代天文学中起着承上启下的重要作用。通过本课程学习，希望学生了解观测星系的各种技术方法，星系的结构、运动和分布，以及解释这些观测性质的基本物理概念，为今后学习更深入的课程，进行科学研究和做学位论文打下基础。

预修课程
普通物理，高等数学

教材
教材：Linda S. Sparke & John S. Gallagher III, 2000, Galaxies in the Universe: An Introduction, Cambridge University Press

主要内容
第一章、引论（6课时）
初步介绍恒星、银河系、河外星系、星系和宇宙的一些基本概念，使学生对恒星、银河系、河外星系、星系和宇宙有一个大体的知识体系，同时也讲一些天文的基本概念，使在本科没有上过基础天文课的学生对天文的一些基础知识有一个初步的认识，使他们在后续的课程中能跟的上进度。这一章需要补充的知识较多。
第二章、银河系的结构（6课时）
较详细地介绍银河系的结构：包括太阳邻域恒星的特性，如太阳附近恒星的颜色-星等图、光度函数等；星团的性质；银河系的旋转曲线，奥尔特常数的具体推导。使同学们对银河系有一个较全面的认识。
第三章、恒星的运动（8课时）
这一章是重点，详细讨论银河系中恒星在引力作用下的运动、二体弛豫、盘星的轨道、无碰撞玻尔兹曼方程。这一章除了让学生在概念上理解银河系中恒星的运动，还要在严密的数学推导中理解银河系中恒星的运动。
引力作用下的运动、二体弛豫（4课时，重点）；
盘星的轨道、无碰撞玻尔兹曼方程（4课时，重点）
第四章、本星系群（8课时）
介绍银河系的伴星系的一些性质，对银河系中的两个很重要的伴星系大、小麦哲伦星系进行较详细地介绍：包括它们的颜色-星等图，它们中变星的性质；对本星系群中的旋涡星系、矮星系以及本星系群的过去和未来进行详细的介绍：M31和M33的一些基本性质；本星系群中矮星系受银河系潮汐的作用，它们轨道的寿命。
银河系的伴星系、本星系群中的旋涡星系、本群中的星系是如何形成的？（4课时）；
矮星系、本星系群的历史和未来（4课时）
第五章、旋涡星系和透镜星系（5课时）
介绍旋涡星系和透镜星系的一些基本性质，主要讲授旋涡星系的面源测光、旋臂的性质及旋臂形成的密度波理论。
第六章、椭圆星系（5课时）
介绍椭圆星系的一些基本性质，讲授椭圆星系的面源测光，理论上推导椭圆星系的旋转，讲解三轴星系中的恒星轨道及椭圆星系的多样性。
第七章、星系群和星系团（5课时）
介绍星系群和星系团的基本性质；理论上推导星系群中星系的近交会、动力学摩擦、强交会、快速交会，简介星系中棒和旋涡的产生；讲解星系的形成；介绍引力透镜，星系和星系团中引力透镜现象。
第八章：星系的大尺度分布（12课时）
这一章主要讲解星系大尺度结构的观测，今天星系的大尺度结构：星系群、星系团和超星系团的分布，一些巡天结果给出的星系大尺度结构；星系成团的度量；讲解均匀宇宙膨胀的一些基本性质：推导宇宙膨胀中两点之间的距离、固有时、宇宙膨胀的速率和暗能量等一些基本公式；讲解高红移星系中的一些基本概念和公式：光度、大小和面亮度，以及各参量和红移的关系，星系的光谱和侧光红移；星系结构的增长和宇宙微波背景辐射的涨落；星系的本动速度以及利用星系本动速度求星系团的质量，星系受到潮汐后的自转；宇宙中结构的形成。这一章是难点，理论推导较多。通过概念的讲解和理论公式的推导，使学生能够掌握星系的大尺度结构。
今天的大尺度结构（3课时）；
均匀宇宙的膨胀（3课时，难点）；
高红移星系（3课时，难点）；
结构的增长（3课时，难点）
第九章：活动星系核和星系的早期历史（5课时）
这一章主要介绍活动星系核、类星体吸收线和第一批星系，使同学们对高能现象有初步了解，对活动星系核和类星体的基本概念及观测手段有所认识，了解第一批星系的形成及宇宙的恒星形成史。

教学手段与方法： 教室授课，利用投影仪。
考核方式：课堂开卷和平时作业成绩。

参考文献
参考文献：(1) J. Binney & M.Merrifield, 1998, Galactic Astronomy, 3rd edition, Princeton University Press； (2) J. Binney & S. Tremaine, 2008, Galactic Dynamics, Princeton University Press

课程教师信息
马骏，国家天文台http://batc.bao.ac.cn/~majun/

行星科学导论

课程编码：070401M04007H 英文名称：Fundamental Planetary Sciences 课时：60 学分：3.00 课程属性：专业核心课 主讲教师：郭建恒等

教学目的要求
行星科学是一门高度综合了天文学和行星科学的学科。本课程试图从以下几个视角介绍行星科学的基本研究范畴、方法和进展。具体包括1）行星系统动力学及行星的形成与演化； 2）太阳系中的小天体；2）行星物质和内部结构；4）行星地质学；5）行星大气的结构、辐射和逃逸。每个专题均涉及到行星科学研究的重要组成部分，通过该课程的学习，为行星科学和天文学专业研究生从事行星科学研究打下扎实的专业基础。

预修课程
高等数学、普通物理学

教材
教师课件，教材之后整理完成。

主要内容
第一部分 行星系统动力学及行星的形成与演化（周礼勇，15学时）
1.1 太阳系行星观测事实、行星的轨道特征（3学时）
太阳系内各行星的基本物理参数，行星轨道构型；二体问题、空间中的轨道、轨道计算与星历表计算；受摄的二体问题、太阳系动力学稳定性。
1.2 轨道动力学与太阳系外行星系统（3学时）
卫星系统轨道；第三体摄动，轨道共振、长期共振、自旋-轨道共振；各种共振动力学机制对行星、卫星系统的影响，太阳系小天体空间分布与轨道共振；太阳系外行星系统的观测、太阳系外行星系统的特征。
1.3限制性三体问题与特洛伊小天体
各行星特洛伊小天体的基本情况；限制性三体问题；三角平动点极其稳定性；洛希瓣、希尔半径、梯塞朗参数；特洛伊小天体的起源及其轨道稳定性；近地小天体、彗星。
1.4小天体动力学（3学时）
洛希限与行星环系；潮汐作用的动力学机制，潮汐作用对行星系统的影响；主带小行星与柯伊柏带天体的观测事实，主带小行星与柯伊伯带天体空间分布的形成与演化；影响小天体运动的非引力因素。
1.5 行星系统的形成及演化（3学时）
星周盘的形成与演化；角动量转移；由星子到行星胚胎的成长；行星胚胎的散射；类地行星形成；大行星核吸积气体过程；引力不稳定机制形成大行星；行星系统的后期演化。

第二部分 太阳系中的小天体（李荐扬，9学时）
2.1 小行星（3学时）
小行星基本观测方法和研究手段，表面光学性质，热学性质，动力学演化和碰撞过程，Yarkovsky Effect和YORP Effect，表面成分，光谱型及空间分布，表面空间风化，内部结构，尺寸分布与撞击坑定年，表面地质过程，小行星深空探测

2.2 彗星（3学时）
彗星基本观测方法和研究手段，基本物理性质，动力学演化和分类，库伊伯带和奥特云，彗星活动基本特性，气体彗发基本性质和化学成分，尘埃彗发基本性质，成分和动力学演化，彗发和太阳风的相互作用，彗核的基本性质和演化，表面地质过程，彗星深空探测。

2.3 其他小天体和太阳系起源与演化（3学时）
特洛伊天体，半人马天体，活动小行星和主带彗星，行星系统起源与动力学演化，Grand Tack Model，NICE model，彗星形成与动力学演化

第三部分 行星物质与内部结构（惠鹤九，9学时）
3.1 地外物质及其来源（惠鹤九，3学时）
陨石的分类以及来源，登月返回样品的种类，矿物和岩石，岩浆演化过程，鲍文反应序列。
3.2 行星化学（惠鹤九，3学时）
元素的起源和在太阳系的丰度，地外物质中的化学元素和同位素分异及其特征，放射性同位素定年，行星形成及演化在地外物质中的记录。
3.3 行星内部结构（惠鹤九，3学时）
地震波的基本概念以及在圈层结构研究中的重要作用，地球的圈层结构-壳幔核，行星内部的实验室模拟（各种高压装置），相图，状态方程，行星的重力场，行星内部的温度，热源以及能量的传播。天体的圈层结构研究现状，以及重要地质事件。


第四部分 行星地质学（肖智勇，4次课，12学时）
4.1. 引言 (1学时)
4.1.1行星地质学的研究范畴
4.1.2行星地质学的起源
4.1.3行星地质学的当前发展状况
4.1.4行星地质学的研究意义
4.2. 行星表面的火山活动（2学时）
4.2.1 火山活动的基本要素：热源和物性的差异
4.2.2 火山活动的表征：类地天体、具有冰质壳层的天体、小行星和彗星表面的构造特征
4.3. 撞击过程及撞击坑研究（3学时）
4.3.1 撞击坑的基本特征
4.3.2 撞击过程的基本物理规律
4.3.3 撞击坑年代学
4.3.4 撞击过程研究方法
4.3.5 地球撞击坑研究
4.4. 行星表面的构造作用（2学时）
4.4.1 构造作用的基本要素：应力和物性的差异
4.4.2 构造运动的表征：类地天体、具有冰质壳层的天体、小行星及彗星表面的构造特征
4.4.3 构造运动的研究手段：观测数据类型、有限元数值模拟简介、物理模拟简介
4.5. 行星表面地质过程的常用工具（1学时）
4.5.1 光学相机数据及其处理方法
4.5.2 反照率光谱数据及其处理方法
4.5.3 高程数据及其处理方法
4.5.4 常用工具介绍
4.6. 水星、金星、月球、火星和小行星的一些基本表面特征及演化历史 （3学时）
4.6.1 水星和月球的表面特征及演化历史
4.6.2 金星的表面特征及演化历史
4.6.3 火星的表面特征及演化历史
4.6.4 小行星的表面特征及演化历史


第五部分 行星大气（郭建恒，15学时）
5.1 行星大气的基本物理和化学过程(3学时)
行星大气中粒子的相互作用、碰撞、电离和化学反应以及这些过程中的动量和能量分配过程。
5.２ 行星大气的基本结构（3学时）
行星大气中的流体静力学平衡与标高，分子扩散与湍流扩散，行星大气的分层结构及形成原因。
5.3 行星大气的温度结构和辐射现象（4学时）
行星大气中的辐射传输、大气热辐射谱与反射谱、行星不同大气层决定温度的主要因素、大气原子与分子光谱、发射线和吸收线的产生机制及其所含物理信息。
5.４ 行星大气的起源和演化（1学时）
行星大气的形成和演化以及与太阳辐射的关联。
5.5 行星大气的逃逸（4学时）
大气稳定性、大气分子的逃逸和沉降，热逃逸（包括流体动力学逃逸）和非热逃逸。

参考文献
暂无

课程教师信息
郭建恒，云南大学物理系学士、中国科学院云南天文台博士。现为中国科学院云南天文台研究员。曾在美国麻省理工学院等机构做访问学者。主要研究方向为太阳系外行星高层大气的流体、磁流体动力学、行星可宜居性、恒星星风的流体辐射过程和恒星振动等。在ApJ和 A&A等刊物发表论文十余篇。
周礼勇，男，南京大学基础学科教学强化部学士、南京大学天文系博士、现为南京大学天文与空间科学学院教授、南京大学空间科学与技术系主任，曾先后在芬兰图尔库大学、巴西圣保罗大学、奥地利维也纳大学、台湾清华大学等机构做博士后学者及访问学者。主要研究方向为太阳系天体动力学、行星系统动力学、非线性天体力学，在MNRAS等国际SCI期刊发表论文30余篇。
惠鹤九，男，中国科学技术大学地球与空间科学学院学士、美国密歇根大学地质科学系博士、美国月球和行星研究所及诺特丹大学博士后、中组部青年千人计划获得者、现为南京大学地球科学与工程学院教授、主要研究领域为通过天然样品分析、高温高压实验模拟以及数学模型计算等方法研究月球和行星的地质演化，在包括Nature Geoscience、GCA、EPSL等国际一流SCI刊物发表多篇高引用论文。
李荐扬，男，中国科学技术大学物理系学士，美国马里兰大学天文系博士，现为美国行星科学研究所高级研究员。为NASA的几个重要小行星探测项目如Deep Impact、Stardust-NExT、Dawn、EPOXI、OSIRIS-REx等科学工作组重要成员，主持或参与NASA各类研究专项项目40余个。在Science、Nature、ApJ、Icarus等国际SCI期刊发表学术论文70余篇，引文2000余次。为了表彰其在小行星科学领域所做出的贡献，国际天文联合会将第21496号小行星命名为李荐扬星。
肖智勇博士毕业于中国地质大学（武汉）、华中科技大学和亚利桑那大学，分获计算机+英语双学士学位、行星地质与化学博士学位；挪威奥斯陆大学博士后；德国弗赖堡大学访问学者。自2014年1月任中国地质大学（武汉）副教授，2016年1月至今任澳门科技大学特聘副教授。NASA水星MESENGER、中国嫦娥3号、嫦娥4号核心科学家团队成员。研究方向是行星地质学，重点关注行星表面过程。已发表学术论文52篇（SCI收录41篇，其中第一作者和通讯作者SCI论文17篇，13篇唯一第一+通讯EPSL+GRL+JGR+Icarus+Geomorpgology+PSS），出版行星科学研究专著1部。全部论文在SCI中总引633次，他引527次。入选第二批中国科协青年人才托举工程。

天文地球动力学

课程编码：070402M04002H 英文名称：Astro-geodynamics 课时：60 学分：3.00 课程属性：专业核心课 主讲教师：黄乘利等

教学目的要求
天文地球动力学是用天文学手段（包括空间大地测量）测定和研究行星地球各种运动状态及其力学机制的一门学科，是天文学与大地测量学和地球物理学的交叉学科。本课程将
1) 聚焦于建立天文地球动力学基本概念体系、阐述学科的基础理论框架、描述学科的主要研究目标和实现这些目标的基本方法和技术手段、讨论学科的应用方向及研究意义；
2) 全面介绍各种空间大地测量技术（VLBI、SLR/LLR、GNSS、重力场测量、等）的最基本原理、技术方法、观测流程、数据处理与数据分析方法、以及相关的应用与科学研究成果；
3) 为学生以后进一步深入到相关的专业（天文地球动力学理论及其应用、上述各种空间大地测量资料分析及其应用等）学习打好基础。
将采取理论授课、师生互动、观测数据处理分析的上机实习等相互有机结合的方式，训练并促进学生的基本研究能力和实践能力的共同发展，扩展知识视野。对学生的考核将采用理论和实践相结合方式。
共计24次课，60学时，其中课堂授课12周（每周2次，每次2或3学时，期末安排考试）。

预修课程
高等数学、大学物理

教材
教师课件，自编教材

主要内容
一、天文地球动力学概论（黄乘利，15学时）
基本概念体系、阐述学科的基础理论框架、描述学科的主要研究目标和实现这些目标的基本方法和技术手段、讨论学科的应用方向及研究意义
1、 引言：
课程介绍；
天文地球动力学发展历史及其在基本天文学和地球科学发展中的地位；
学科的主要研究目标；
实现这些目标的基本方法和技术手段及各自的优缺点

2、 基本概念（I）：
1)天球参考系/架（CRF）的定义及各种CRF；2)地球参考系/架（TRF）的定义及各种TRF；3)地球自转参数（ERP/EOP）基本概念；
4)参考架连接；
5)综合EOP与综合地球参考架；
6)极移与岁差/章动的区分与表示；
3、基本概念（II）：
7)各种时间系统的定义、实现及相互关系；
8)相对论框架下的时空参考架及有关问题；
9)太阳系行星历表；
10)空间大地测量资料处理过程中的各种天文和地球物理因素及其模型（参考IERS规范）：大气折射、电离层延迟、相对论时延、各种潮汐（固体潮、海潮、海洋负荷潮、极潮）、等等

4、 学科的应用方向及研究意义：以地球自转变化研究为例（I）：
地球自转变化与地球各圈层物质（大气、海洋、地壳、地幔和地核）运动在各种时间尺度的相互作用过程与机理，即地球自转变化的各种地球物理激发机制
5、 学科的应用方向及研究意义：以地球自转变化研究为例（II）：
最新的IAU岁差－章动模型及其问题；
6、 学科的应用方向及研究意义：其他领域：相关研究的最新进展述评

二、甚长基线干涉测量（VLBI）技术（王广利，10学时）
目的：了解VLBI基本原理、技术方法、观测流程、数据处理与数据分析方法，以及相关的应用研究成果
7、 VLBI技术简介、几何原理与理论模型：VLBI的简要发展历史，射电天文基础，VLBI技术的数学原理、物理模型
8、 VLBI技术原理与观测处理过程：VLBI技术各环节的基本工作原理，台站技术、相关处理。
9、 VLBI数据分析方法：VLBI观测组织实施过程。VLBI数据分析原理，实现方法；
10、 VLBI数据的科学应用：VLBI技术对现代科学研究和应用的贡献，国际上相关研究的最新进展

三、全球卫星导航系统（GNSS）（陈俊平，15学时）：
了解卫星导航基本原理，技术方法，数据处理与数据分析方法，相关的应用研究成果。掌握卫星导航基础理论，观测流程，以及数据处理方法。

11、卫星导航简介、几何原理与理论模型：星导航的简要发展历史，卫星导航技术的数学原理、物理模型
12、卫星导航技术原理与观测处理过程：卫星导航技术各环节的基本工作原理，定轨/定位/授时原理
13、卫星导航数据分析方法：卫星导航数据分析原理、实现方法；
14、卫星导航数据的科学应用：GNSS技术对现代科学研究和应用的贡献，国际上相关研究的最新进展。
15、北斗卫星导航系统特点：讲解北斗卫星导航系统建设过程中形成的独特体制及解决方法。
16、北斗卫星导航最新进展及未来发展：介绍北斗卫星导航系统广域差分以及全球系统的发展

四、人卫/月球激光测距（SLR/LLR）技术（王小亚，10学时）：
掌握SLR基本原理和测量及动力学模型，了解摄动量级估计方法及其大概量级，了解SLR数据处理方法，掌握相关的应用研究，了解SLR数据处理流程和基本数据处理策略。 数学原理、物理模型
17、SLR技术简介、几何原理与理论模型：SLR发展历史、数学原理、物理模型
18、SLR技术原理与观测处理过程：SLR数据处理测量和动力学模型介绍及摄动量级估计
19、SLR数据分析方法：SLR数据分析原理、实现方法
20、SLR数据的科学应用：SLR技术对现代科学研究和应用的贡献，国际上相关研究的最新进展

五、地球重力场及其时变性的测定与研究（李进，8学时）：
21、地球重力场的测定：简介各种地面和空间重力观测技术的原理；综合空间和地面重力观测确定地球重力场的理论和方法；
22、地球重力场及其时变性的研究：对地球重力场的时变性与地球大气、地表水和海洋质量的变迁、冰期后地壳回弹的关系研究最新进展；
23、地球重力场及其时变性的研究：对地球重力场的时变性与地球质心变化、地震、地球自转变化等的关系研究最新进展；

六、期末考试（2学时）
期末考试（2学时）：期末考试。
教学手段与方法： 课堂授课与项目实习结合
考核方式： 闭卷考试
教材：教师课件，教材之后整理完成。

参考文献
1.叶叔华，黄珹，天文地球动力学，山东科学技术出版社，2000年12月
